Extracted Data.Name: Shruthi Krishnamurthy
Extracted Data.Summary or Objective: Overall 6+ years of experience, In that having 5+ years of experience in Data Analysis and Reporting various Business related data and worked as Global Lead Analyst for a Primary Intelligence Delivery Center.

Experience.Title: Lead Analyst
Experience.Description: Hands on experience in analyzing the sales representative data and patient data metrics with the physicians to facilitate the pharmaceutical business decisions. Have good knowledge about database concepts and design. Well versed with DDL, DRL, DML Statements, Joins, Sub Query and Functions. Built and maintained SQL scripts, views, indexes and complex queries to extract the data from database. Good knowledge of Data warehousing methodologies and concepts, including Star Schema, Snowflake Schema, ETL Processes, Dimensional modeling. Collating data from different sources and preparing the reports Using Power BI. Comfortable in working with Power Query Editor for data transformations. Well versed in usage of DAX Calculations. Ability to create New Calculated Column and Measure using DAX Expression. Worked on Power BI reports & dashboards with different data sources. Ability to create reports with bookmarks and insights using Power BI. Have good knowledge to create and maintain reports with Row Level Security to ensure data is securely shared to the end users. Extraction of the ad hoc reports in MicroStrategy as per the client requirements. Excellent in MS Excel (Index and match, Lookup, Pivot Table, Charts, Forms, Data Validation & Scenarios). Proficient in data cleansing and analysis techniques using advance excel features. Directly interacting with the stakeholders to understand the custom report requirements. Extracting data from the internal dataset to Publish deliverable reports. Responsible for ensuring all weekly, monthly and quarterly reports are reported out accurately as per scheduled time. Strong verbal and writing skills, project and time management skills, ability to work in team. Willing to learn and try new things proactively, entrepreneurial in nature, self motivated.

Experience.Title: Graduate NEEM Trainee
Experience.Company: Yashaswi Group (Bharat Heavy Electricals Ltd EDN)
Experience.Description: Worked with SAP Version 7.10 system. Creating the Service entry sheets against purchase order in SAP system. Entering the vendor monthly bill amount in service Entry sheet i.e. ML81N for passing the bill to Contractor. Vendor s EMD registration in SAP. Vendor s bill registration in SAP. Creating and editing of Purchase Order in SAP.

Certifications: Data Analytics and Business Intelligence Certification (October 2019 – January 2020)
Extracted Data.Education: Bachelor of Computer Applications, GT Institute of Management Studies and Research, Bangalore (June 2014 – June 2017).

Recommendations: Consider adding a **projects section** to showcase practical applications of your skills and experience, even if they are personal projects. This can demonstrate your initiative and problem-solving abilities to potential employers and also helps to boost your resume.

While the summary provides an overview, consider **quantifying your achievements** in the experience section with metrics or numbers to highlight the impact of your work. For Example, instead of saying 'Improved report generation', say 'Improved report generation time by 30%'.

Ensure consistent formatting throughout the resume, paying attention to **font styles, spacing, and alignment**. A visually appealing resume is easier to read and creates a positive first impression and to ensure a professional and polished look.

Tailor the resume **keywords to match specific job descriptions**. Review the job postings you're applying for and incorporate relevant keywords throughout your resume to increase its visibility to ATS systems and recruiters.

In your work experience, it could be beneficial to incorporate **action verbs** at the beginning of each bullet point to clearly and concisely convey the accomplishments and responsibilities, enhancing readability.

Proofread your resume carefully for any typos or grammatical errors, and consider using a **grammar checker** or having someone else review it. Errors can detract from your credibility and undermine the overall quality of the application.

Although you have several certifications, consider adding any **relevant coursework or academic projects** under the education section, especially if they align with the target jobs. This can further highlight relevant skills and knowledge acquired during your studies.

PSYCHOMETRIC.questions: How do you handle situations where you have to make critical decisions with limited data?
PSYCHOMETRIC.answer: I prioritize understanding the key variables and potential outcomes, consult with relevant team members, and make a decision based on the best available information while remaining adaptable to new information as it arises.

PSYCHOMETRIC.questions: Describe a time when you had to adapt to a significant change in your work environment or role. How did you handle it?
PSYCHOMETRIC.answer: In my previous role, a new reporting system was implemented. I proactively learned the new system, identified its advantages and disadvantages, and trained my team to ensure a smooth transition. I focused on the benefits of improved data accuracy and efficiency.

PSYCHOMETRIC.questions: How do you approach prioritizing tasks when you have multiple competing deadlines?
PSYCHOMETRIC.answer: I assess the urgency and impact of each task, align them with overall business objectives, and create a realistic schedule. I communicate proactively with stakeholders about potential delays and adjust priorities as needed.

Soft_Skills.questions: Describe a situation where you had to collaborate with a cross-functional team to achieve a goal. What were the key challenges, and how did you overcome them?
Soft_Skills.answer: I collaborated with the sales, marketing, and supply chain teams to forecast demand for a new product launch. The main challenge was aligning different perspectives and data sources. I facilitated open communication, used data visualization to highlight key insights, and built consensus through collaborative workshops.

Soft_Skills.questions: How do you ensure effective communication with team members and stakeholders, especially when dealing with complex data or analytical findings?
Soft_Skills.answer: I tailor my communication style to the audience, use clear and concise language, and present data in a visually appealing format. I also actively solicit feedback and encourage open dialogue to ensure everyone understands the key insights and recommendations.

Soft_Skills.questions: Tell me about a time when you had to influence a decision or persuade someone to adopt your recommendation. What strategies did you use?
Soft_Skills.answer: I prepared a detailed analysis of inventory turnover rates and presented it to the management team, highlighting the potential cost savings and efficiency gains. I supported my recommendation with data-driven insights, addressed potential concerns, and demonstrated the value of the proposed changes.

Behavioral.questions: Tell me about a time when you had to analyze a large dataset to identify trends or insights. What tools did you use, and what was the outcome?
Behavioral.answer:
Situation: In my role as a Lead Analyst, I was tasked with analyzing a large dataset of sales representative data to identify trends and insights.
Task: My task was to use analytical tools and techniques to extract meaningful information from the dataset, which could inform business decisions and improve sales performance.
Action: I used SQL to extract and clean the data from various sources. Then, I used Power BI to create visualizations and dashboards to identify key trends and patterns in the data. I also used advanced Excel functions like pivot tables and lookups to perform more in-depth analysis.
Result: The analysis revealed that certain sales representatives were consistently outperforming others in specific regions. We used these insights to implement targeted training programs and adjust sales strategies, which led to a 15% increase in overall sales performance.

Behavioral.questions: Describe a situation where you had to manage inventory levels to meet demand while minimizing costs. What challenges did you face, and how did you address them?
Behavioral.answer:
Situation: During a period of rapid growth, our company faced challenges in managing inventory levels to meet increasing demand while minimizing costs.
Task: My task was to optimize inventory levels across our retail and online channels to ensure we had enough stock to meet customer demand without incurring excessive storage costs or risking stockouts.
Action: I implemented a demand forecasting model using historical sales data and seasonality trends. I also worked with the merchandising team to adjust forecasts for new launches and promotions. We defined min-max levels for each store and FOFO franchise and initiated timely transfers from the central warehouse to replenish stock.
Result: As a result of these actions, we were able to improve our store fill rate by 20%, reduce stockouts by 10%, and decrease inventory holding costs by 15%.

Behavioral.questions: Tell me about a time when you had to create a report or dashboard to communicate complex data to stakeholders. What steps did you take to ensure the information was clear and actionable?
Behavioral.answer:
Situation: I was responsible for creating a dashboard to communicate complex data about inventory health and store performance to leadership and planning teams.
Task: My task was to build a dashboard that provided clear, actionable insights into key metrics like inventory turnover, forecast accuracy, and store fill rate.
Action: I used Power BI to create interactive dashboards with visualizations and drill-down capabilities. I worked closely with stakeholders to understand their specific reporting needs and tailored the dashboard accordingly. I also automated the reporting process to ensure the information was always up-to-date and accurate.
Result: The dashboard was well-received by stakeholders and became a key tool for monitoring inventory health and making data-driven decisions. It improved forecast accuracy by 12% and led to better inventory optimization across our channels.

easy.questions: Explain the difference between a pivot table and a lookup function in Excel.
easy.answer: A pivot table summarizes and analyzes large datasets, allowing you to reorganize and extract insights. A lookup function (e.g., VLOOKUP, INDEX-MATCH) retrieves specific data from a table based on a search value.

easy.questions: What is DAX in Power BI, and how is it used?
easy.answer: DAX (Data Analysis Expressions) is a formula language used in Power BI to create calculated columns, measures, and custom tables. It's used to perform advanced calculations and data analysis.

easy.questions: What is the purpose of SQL, and what are its basic components?
easy.answer: SQL (Structured Query Language) is used to manage and manipulate databases. Its basic components include DDL (Data Definition Language), DML (Data Manipulation Language), and DQL (Data Query Language).

medium.questions: Describe a situation where you used advanced Excel functions to perform data cleansing and analysis. What specific functions did you use, and why?
medium.answer: I used functions like INDEX-MATCH, SUMIFS, and COUNTIFS to clean and analyze sales data. INDEX-MATCH was used for flexible lookups, SUMIFS for conditional aggregation, and COUNTIFS for counting occurrences based on multiple criteria, resulting in a clean and accurate dataset for reporting.

medium.questions: How would you use Power BI to create a dashboard for monitoring inventory health and store performance? What key metrics would you include, and how would you visualize them?
medium.answer: I would include metrics like inventory turnover ratio, store fill rate, and stockout percentage. I would use visualizations like line charts for trends, bar charts for comparisons, and KPIs for highlighting key performance indicators, making the dashboard interactive and informative.

medium.questions: Explain how you would use SQL to extract data from multiple tables and create a report showing sales by region and product category.
medium.answer: I would use JOIN operations to combine data from the sales, region, and product tables. Then, I would use GROUP BY and aggregate functions like SUM to calculate total sales for each region and product category, creating a detailed sales report.

hard.questions: Design a demand forecasting model that incorporates historical sales data, seasonality trends, and marketing inputs. How would you evaluate the accuracy of your model and adjust it over time?
hard.answer: I would use a time series forecasting model like ARIMA, incorporating seasonality indices and marketing promotion data as external regressors. I would evaluate the model using metrics like RMSE and MAE, and continuously update it with new data and insights to improve accuracy.

hard.questions: Describe a scenario where you had to optimize inventory levels across multiple retail locations with varying demand patterns. How would you determine the optimal min-max levels for each location, and what factors would you consider?
hard.answer: I would use ABC classification to categorize inventory based on sales volume and profitability. For A items, I would use statistical forecasting techniques to determine min-max levels, considering factors like lead time, safety stock, and demand variability. For B and C items, I would use simpler methods and focus on minimizing carrying costs.

hard.questions: How would you use SQL to identify slow-moving and overstocked items in a large inventory database? What queries would you write, and how would you present the results to stakeholders?
hard.answer: I would write SQL queries to calculate inventory turnover ratio and days of supply for each item. Items with low turnover and high days of supply would be flagged as slow-moving or overstocked. I would present the results in a dashboard with visualizations showing the value and quantity of these items, along with recommendations for liquidation or promotional activities.
